question.content:
A dumbbell shaped equipotential surface is observed during an experiment.

[[☃ image 1]]

**Which of the following configurations creates this equipotential surface?**    
*Note: $\redC{\bullet}$ is a $+$ point charge, $\blue{\bullet}$ is a $-$ point charge.*

[[☃ radio 1]]

hints.content:
##Strategy

An equipotential surface is perpendicular to the electric field at every point.

Let's pick any choice, draw the electric field lines by hand as accurately as we can, and see if we can construct an equipotential surface that looks like the one given.

##Solution

- *[Check out this video](https://www.khanacademy.org/science/in-in-class-12th-physics-india/in-in-electrostatic-potential-and-capacitance/x51bd77206da864f3:equipotential-surfaces/v/equipotential-surfaces-of-two-charges-dipoles) to understand how equipotential surfaces look when multiple charges are present.*

----

If we apply the principle here, we only find one correct case: two like charges (both positive in this case) of equal magnitude.

![](https://ka-perseus-images.s3.amazonaws.com/7cc6c8ee82d14917316ceec0a2b8d18f89539ce8.png)
